required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Pharmacokinetics and Safety of TNX-102 SL Tablets and Cyclobenzaprine Oral Tablet in Healthy Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Dose, Open-Label, Randomized, Parallel-Design Study of the Comparative Pharmacokinetics and Safety of TNX-102 2.4 mg SL Tablets (With Phosphate) at 2.4 mg and 4.8 mg, TNX-102-A 2.4 mg SL Tablets (Without Phosphate) at 2.4 mg and Cyclobenzaprine 5 mg Oral Tablets in Healthy Adults.

brief_summary.textblock: Very low dose (VLD) cyclobenzaprine at bedtime has shown promise as a treatment for fibromyalgia, but the chemistry of cyclobenzaprine requires new formulation technology for bedtime use. The present trial is designed to assess the safety and tolerability of TNX-102 2.4 mg SL Tablets (a new formulation of cyclobenzaprine designed to result in increased dosage precision and decreased potential for morning grogginess) at 2.4 mg and 4.8 mg and to compare the bio-availability of TNX-102 2.4 mg SL Tablets at 2.4 mg and 4.8 mg to that of TNX-102-A 2.4 mg SL Tablets (without phosphate) at 2.4 mg and cyclobenzaprine (5 mg tablets).

primary_outcome.measure: Measured levels of cyclobenzaprine and norcyclobenzaprine in plasma and urine
primary_outcome.time_frame: 27 time points per period for blood assessment ; 3 pooled analyses in urine.
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be taken per period: within 30 minutes pre-dose and 2, 3.5, 5, 10, 20, 30, and 45 minutes and 1, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.33, 3.67, 4, 4.33, 4.67, 5, 5.5, 6, 8, 12, 16, 24, 36, 48, and 72 hours post-dose. A single urine sample will be collected within 30 minutes pre-dose (one sample), and urine will be pooled from 0-24, 24-48 and 48-72 hours post-dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of TNX-102 SL Tablets at 2.4 mg and 4.8 mg.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Continuously until the end (day 4) of the study period + Telephone follow-up 7-13 days after dosing (total duration: about 1 month)
primary_outcome.description: Every adverse events occurring during the study period will be reported.

arm_group.description: 1 x TNX-102 SL Tablets at 2.4 mg
2 x TNX-102 SL Tablets at 2.4 mg
1 x TNX-102-A (without phosphate) SL Tablet at 2.4 mg

intervention.description: 1 TNX-102 SL Tablet at 2.4 mg held under the tongue until dissolution, without swallowing or chewing it.
2 TNX-102 SL Tablet at 2.4 mg held under the tongue until dissolution, without swallowing or chewing them.
1 TNX-102-A SL Tablet at 2.4 mg held under the tongue until dissolution, without swallowing or chewing it.
1 x 5 mg cyclobenzaprine tablet, swallowed with 240 mL of room-temperature water

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy adults
- Male or female
- Non-smoker
- 18-65 years old
- BMI > 18.5 and < 30.0
- With medically acceptable form of contraception (female only)
- With signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any clinically significant abnormality including ECG abnormalities or vital sign abnormalities (systolic blood pressure < 90 or > 140 mmHg,
- Diastolic blood pressure lower < 50 or > 90 mmHg, or heart rate < 50 or > 100 BPM)
- Any abnormal laboratory test (including positivity for Hep B, Hep C, HIV, and
- Hemoglobin < 128 g/L (males) or < 115 g/L (females) and hematocrit < 0.37 L/L (males) or < 0.32 L/L (females))
- History of alcohol or drug abuse or dependence within 1 year and/or positive drug, cotinine, or alcohol tests
- Use of any drug (within 30 days), supplement, or food (within 14 days) known to induce or inhibit hepatic drug metabolism prior to study medication
- Positive pregnancy test, breastfeeding or lactating
- Use of medication other than hormonal contraceptives or topical products, including OTC, natural health products, MAO inhibitors
- Participation in an investigational study within 30 days prior to dosing
- Donation of plasma (within 7 days), or donation or loss of blood of 50-499 mL (within 30 days), or of > 499 mL (within 56 days) prior to dosing.
